candidates.name: Brendan Bruce Maddern
candidates.why_elect: While I have my views on national politics, I am in no way beholden to them. My singular focus will be, Auckland. Action must be taken now, whether or not the capital is on board. We have outgrown Wellington. Aucklanders understand our city best.
candidates.why_stand: I did not want to run for Mayor. I waited for someone better known than me to promote a future for Auckland that I could believe in. That it has come down to me to offer this vision to a city of 1.5 million people is a scary responsibility.

candidates.name: Thanh Binh Nguyen
candidates.why_elect: I have visions which are as sincere, strong as possible so we can share and realize for ourself, our families, our communities and city I am believing the visions and goals can be realized through willingness, knowledge, creativity and determination. Let's unfurl our resolutions.
candidates.why_stand: To realize my visions, goals and ideals for Auckland city. Consolidate and strengthen the supercity. Unify our regions, cities, people and resources. Strengthen our political structures, economics forces and environmental partners.

candidates.name: Glen Snelgar
candidates.why_elect: I'm an average Aucklander, not a career politician. I grew up on Struggle Street in South Auckland and now I run a school in the Auckland CBD. I use the road and PT network everyday, so I know our communities are hurting from paying new taxes but getting zero improvements.
candidates.why_stand: I came back to Auckland from overseas and I was shocked to find that many promises from 20 years ago still had not been fulfilled. Traffic and congestion have gotten worse and that is putting pedestrians and cyclists in danger. What's more we need to pay more for less.

candidates.name: Tricia Cheel
candidates.why_elect: No one person can solve the crises we face today, but a mandate from voters will mean I can unleash the same energy and commitment I have shown in keeping my neighbourhood as free as possible of toxic chemicals, waste and other pollution, with Friends of Sherwood, since June 1990.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing to give voters the opportunity to take full responsibility for the legacy we are leaving future generations and all life on earth. One million species face extinction, and we cannot continue with the out-of-control, corrupt, corporate, greedy profiteering, that has caused the problems in the first place.

candidates.name: Tadhg Tim Stopford
candidates.why_elect: I'm committed to the big picture, economy, environment, business, citizenship, education, and fun. After 45 years, with 12 years in numerous countries, I believe I have an idea as to what we could be doing better, and how we can do it. My concern is for present and future generations.
candidates.why_stand: Kia ora, and greetings. Aucks is about to change into a medium density city, which means existing problems will get bigger unless addressed. There's no point being 'the world's most liveable city' for 1%. "We don't have money, so we have to think," and that means changing our models. Thoughtfully.

candidates.name: John Tamihere
candidates.why_elect: I have a law and arts degree. Over the past 35 years I have helped those in difficulty. I am the 10th of 12 children born to a staunch Irish Catholic mum and Māori father. I am a father of six and grandfather of eight.
candidates.why_stand: This election is not about Labour or National, right or left. It’s all about Auckland, our city, our people. I want to be the Mayor of Auckland and not a puppet to Wellington. Auckland deserves someone who will champion our city who is not an extension to the bureaucracy.

candidates.name: David John Feist
candidates.why_elect: I have been a lawyer and employment law consultant for over 30 years. I live with my wife and daughter in a house I own in the North Shore. As the director of 0800 SACKED I have seen my generally low income clients suffer with high house costs.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing for Mayor as I am very concerned that this city is becoming increasingly ugly and stressful. Housing is to be demolished and turned into apartments. This will not reduce "dwelling" costs. Where this has been tried overseas apartments cost more than the houses originally did.

candidates.name: Peter Vaughan
candidates.why_elect: Born in Auckland, I helped build the City as an electrician. Understanding construction I know City infrastructure and why Auckland is failing. I find solutions to problems, and with my knowledge of how people tick, I'm not easily manipulated and get teams working together as a unit.
candidates.why_stand: I was asked to run for Mayor because I have a technical background in commercial and industrial fields. I've already discovered solutions, both practical and technologically advanced, for putting the City and it's infrastructure back into a stable order.

candidates.name: Genevieve Forde
candidates.why_elect: My heart is with Mother Earth and the people and animals and birds and fish of Auckland. People can rely on me to keep my word and always do my best for them and our city. Thank you if you decide to put your trust in me with your vote!
candidates.why_stand: I am running for Auckland Mayor because I want Auckland to have a strong climate change policy as described by UN scientists last October, namely a 45% reduction in all greenhouse gas emissions by 2030, or better. Also, to protect Auckland's environment and find homes for the homeless.

candidates.name: Annalucia Vermunt
candidates.why_elect: I have joined protests in defence of Māori land at Ihumatao in south Auckland and is active in the fight for women for full family planning rights, including the right to choose abortion. Vermunt has helped organise protests demanding "United States and Allies Hands Off Cuba and Venezuela!".
candidates.why_stand: The Communist League campaign presents a working-class alternative in the city council elections.

candidates.name: Phil Goff
candidates.why_elect: I am a leader who has integrity, honesty and a reliable track record. Auckland deserves leaders who are there to serve the people, not themselves, which is what I have done my whole life. I want to continue delivering for Auckland as I have done for the last three years.
candidates.why_stand: I grew up in Auckland and I love this city. I want this city to be a great place to live: prosperous, diverse and inclusive; vibrant and exciting, with choice and opportunity for all. My vision for Auckland is for it to be world class and NZ's international city.

candidates.name: Alezix Heneti
candidates.why_elect: My personal qualities of decisiveness, persistence and being an action-taker are what I bring to my role as Mayor of Auckland. Family first is vital and Auckland is my family. Thirty eight years in business and community allows me to give back. For Auckland. I love Auckland. Yes.
candidates.why_stand: I love Auckland, it's so sophisticated, fun and versatile. I've enjoyed living here 25 years, Takapuna, Orewa, Devonport, Henderson and Waterview, and it's time for me to give back by serving you the people and show my, appreciation, thankfulness and gratitude. Proud to be Kiwi and an Aucklander.

candidates.name: John Hong
candidates.why_elect: I have a track record of facilitating and promoting New Zealand and Auckland by all means with all my heart and passion.
candidates.why_stand: Auckland City has the potential to be a greater and more livable city as I have the vision and ability to raise Auckland up to international metropolitan city.

candidates.name: Ted Johnston
candidates.why_elect: We need a strong leader with knowledge expertise and wisdom, not a recycled professional politician. Someone from Auckland who knows our city and its potential. I will provide the vision and driving support to make Auckland reach its true potential as a city on the world stage.
candidates.why_stand: I decided to run for Mayor, because of the sheer incompetence, of council. Its money gouging, traffic congestion, lack of efficient public transport, homelessness, and other major issues being ignored or sidelined. Council fails its prime duties, service provision, control of city and growth, protection of environment, and within budget.

candidates.name: Susanna Kruger
candidates.why_elect: I know first-hand how hard it is to get out of the gutter, once you have fallen through the cracks. I also received an international award for cross-cultural relations, studied Māori for 5+ years, and my clients are from all nations: South Africa, Tonga, Samoa, Fiji, India, China, UK, NZ.
candidates.why_stand: To obtain the mandate to negotiate public land and funds for mobilising the dependents to create a strong home economy, from the grassroots up. In particular, we need life-long leased land to build an African inspired campus to host four social enterprising initiatives, helping families trade themselves out of poverty.

candidates.name: Craig Lord
candidates.why_elect: Because Auckland is desperate for leadership. I'm genuine and grass-roots. I've spent the last 32 years in the trenches working, not in the political trough feeding. I'll listen and fight for all of our communities, and provide genuine accountability of the councillors, the council departments and myself to the people.
candidates.why_stand: My hand went up because like most Aucklanders I was disillusioned by the lack of leadership, inane spending on vanity projects and the dropping of standards for our core services. Auckland needs a change of culture and a leader who focuses on the people and actual needs of the city.
